values: My new Dell laptop is up and running - I had to change the order to an Expresso Brown cover instead of a Blossom Pink (with flowers) or else it would have been another month. Kyle and I have been busy at the studio working on Blake's 1st Year slideshow. We recorded just over 3 hours of raw audio (us talking to Blake about the pregnancy and his first year, etc.), chose 312 pictures and put it all together in a slideshow with background music and the whole works. (Of course, we didn't use all 3 hours of the raw audio - just clips to tell the story and complement the slideshow. We'll put together an AudioScrapbook to include all the important stuff that didn't make it to the slideshow.) Once it's totally finished, I'll post YouTube clips of it for your enjoyment. All we have left to do with it today is to add the audio track to the slideshow and burn the CDs. :D :D :D To mail these out (to family & close friends), I made thank you cards for Blake's birthday. Untie the ribbons to find Blake's hand print. I wasn't sure how the gel finger paints were going to work out, so I used construction paper - only because I knew it wasn't going to directly touch the picture on the front. Kudos to Crayola: all of their stuff is non-toxic and the finger paints are completely washable. They washed off Blake easily, off the plate we used as his pallette, AND off the high chair cover when I did nothing but throw it into the wash. :D Also - if you're wondering - the gel paints don't taste too good either. B stuck his paint-covered fingers in his mouth once, spat that out and didn't try it again. Open the card and see I got to use my new Cricut tool! :D Peek behind inside the inside.... And pull out the CD with Blake's slideshow! A close-up of the flower: And, as always: These were made using 12x12 cardstock for the base card, ribbon, construction paper and gel finger paints (handprint), cardstock for the panels, rubber stamps, embossing markers, embossing powder, heat embossing, and quilting thread (on my sewing machine).

My laptop totolly died last week.... Hopefully our IT guy at work will be able to recover all my pictures. If not, I'll be ordering CDs of everything I've ever uploaded to snapfish.com ....and mourn the loss of about a month's worth of pictures. *sigh* Guess it could be worse, much worse.

I've ordered a new laptop from Dell, but since I just had to have the pink blossom design it won't ship out until mid-October. *sigh* What's a girl to do? Get off the computer and into the studio to make new cards? Oh yeah! Prints to make B's birthday invites should be coming in the mail very soon. The invites will actually just be a formality (with an audio slideshow) sent right before his birthday. Note to self: schedule studio time to record B's 1st year commentary.
I've had lots of fun with the monkeys! Inside: Happy Birthday!

I have made 3 quilts so far this year (this summer)! Of course, they aren't my typical puff quilts.... I figured that I'd drive myself batty trying to finish puff quilts, be a mom and work full-time. The first quilt was a small and simple one for Charlie. I had been looking for some good material to make Charlie a quilt and my mom talked me into (not that she had to try hard) getting this material. Instead of doing squares (as I usually do), the front is has a quilted "look" / pattern. I chose a fairly simple and dark material for the back - I like stuff that doesn't show dirt very much, so you won't ever see much white in the quilts I make. I trimmed it with an "I Love Puppies" print.... ...and finished it by sewing around many of the boxes on the front pattern.

Again, it's been forever since I've posted. I was hoping to post pictures of the thank you cards I sewed - but they must be on Kyle's computer which is in the shop. On the inside (blank) of this one is burgandy with torn edges and metal coils. I also have a bunch of Monkey B-Day cards coming.

Thank you to everyone that stopped by Blue Tower's open house last Saturday! The RiNo open house turned out great. Blake was there and did well. *whispers* He actually took a 2 hour nap at the studio! We were pretty much busy the entire day with people coming and going. Kyle found that recording 3 different artists (Josh Rael, Tyler Bills, and Tiffany Carryne) throughout the day actually kept his ears really fresh and kept him sharp. Needless to say, with all the bustle, I didn't get any new cards made during the open house. That's okay though. Wednesday night Greg McBoat did a fashion shoot at the studio for Adam van Eeckhout's new designs. They actually used mostly the outside of the building and one of the huge vacant spaces in the building...and our rooms for changing & prep. It was really cool. (Plus we got to see Greg, Meka & Adam.) Kyle didn't have any work that he could get done (the red room was off limits for the evening). So he took care of B while I worked on new thank you cards. I brought home the front designs to try out sewing on them. Of course this means I'll have to pull my machine out. I hope it works. I've seen a lot of people using the sewing / stitching techniques and I love the look!

Blake's baptism weekend has been fabulous! Our parents are still in town, but I've found a little bit of time to post what we gave our moms for Mother's Day. I couldn't decide which one to give to who, so I had Kyle wrap them with the cards inside. The page my mom got is a white 12x12 with polka dotted, green and a dusty blue paper. The ribbon is a bright pea green. It is decorated with colored brads, has a sticker title of "blake" and is stamped with "Happy Mother's Day". Along the edge of the polka dot paper I wrote "Mom" and "Grandma" repeatedly and added colored brads. The envelope has a strip of the dotted paper, with a colored brad on one of the dots. The inside has a mat and a couple colored brads. The page Kyle's mom got is a black 12x12 with glittery striped, purple and pea green paper. On the edges of the mats I rubbed pearlescent sky blue ink for a little more pizazz. A flower and "Happy Mother's Day" is stamped in the corner with the same blue ink and is titled "Blake" with stickers. Along the edge of the striped paper I wrote " * Mom * Grandma * Mom * ..." in silver. Have I mentioned that I love black cards? :D On the front of this card is the glittery, striped paper and a purple block (again edge with the blue ink) that says "Happy Mother's Day". The envelope is stamped with the flower I used on the scrapbook page. The inside is also stamped with the flower. Well, I've used up the time Blake's allotted me while he's been playing on the floor.... Hope everyone had a wonderful Mother's Day!
I've posted Mother's Day Cards & Scrapbook Pages on ebay. As always, if you're local to Denver / Boulder...I can get them to you in person, thus saving you shipping.

This is the card I sent for April's challenge. The theme was weather. I wanted to do a rubber ducky & rain drops - but I'm still having a hard time finding rubber duckies that I like. I just may have to break down one of these days and get a Cricut or some other die cut machine. But for now, I give you a Christmas snowflake in April - kind of like the weather in Colorado lately. "Merry Christmas" is embossed in silver and there is a rhinestone in the middle of the snowflake eyelet. The Peace snowflake is on a raised box and has embossed glitter in the middle of it. We've moved into a new apartment and we're getting ready for the RiNo (River North Art District) open house in May... so to say we've been busy lately is an understatement. I could probably count on one hand how many times we've gotten down to the studio this month - including the 2 days Kyle had Julia and Melissa in the studio for Career Day. Anyways, my business cards and magnets came! (My first official mail in the new place.) Let me know if you'd like me to send you one or some. Also - we have postcards and field guides for the RiNo open house, May 17th. I can get you those too. We will be collecting CDs & DVDs to recycle, have 3 artists in doing recording demonstrations, and open mic time. (I'll also have my cards out to sell.)

This card is for March's - Spring / Easter card with non-pastels. I've begun decorating the insides, providing a nice space to write on the inside - especially with the black cards which I'm really digging right now.

*whispers* B's sleeping! :D

Palm Sunday we finally recorded Steph's grandma for her audio scrapbook. We went down to do it in December, but Kyle couldn't get the input to record. There were some settings that he had to redo in the Layla software. We think his former partner, reloaded everything on the laptop to clear all of his personal stuff off when they split....and it defaulted to these settings that were wrong. *shrug* Embarrassing, but at least we were with friends. Lesson learned: always make sure EVERYTHING is working properly before going out for a job. Since the first try life has been absolutely crazy with both of my grandparents passing, our trip to Hawaii, me working out of town for 3 weeks, and just trying to get back into a normal life. *LOL* Did I say "normal", I meant back into a groove.

Back to recording Grandma Ruby.... I wish we would have been able to record all the small talk and stories she told back in December while Kyle was trying to get the Layla work work. *L* She was so relaxed...and that makes for the best recordings. The other Sunday we were finally able to give it another go. This time she was prepared with notes on what she wanted to <strike>read</strike> talk about. Steph's mom and I entertained Blake in the other room, but he was having a ball laughing and babbling - which was consequently caught on tape. Kyle was editing the tape yesterday and another interesting thing is that he kept finding airplanes in the tape. We didn't even notice them when we were recording! So we wonder if Steph's mom lives right under an airpath. It reminded me of one of Dr. Deyo's experiments where the mice were freaking out at night. He did an audio recording overnight and found that there were bats in the attic that were creating noises that the human ear couldn't hear, but the mice could. I think Kyle was able to edit a lot of airplanes out - as well as several of B's screaches. But Grandma and Steph were hoping that he left some of B's babblings in because it was "so cute". Lesson learned: when doing this professionally, B will have to stay home.

I can't wait to hear the final version of Grandma Ruby's audio scrapbook! (Actually, I haven't heard any of it yet.) We think we'll give them a copy of the original recording and the final version. When asked what kind of music she likes - because Kyle will put in background music - Grandma replied "Oh...how about some Glen Miller." *smiles* Done. One of my faves. :D On the way home from the studio last night I had an inspiration. So I think I'll make a 12x12 scrapbook page for Steph to go with the audio scrapbook. Of course, I will have to take a listen first so that it can be tailored to Grandma's stories. So excited!

We're still looking to do more of these audio scrapbooks for free to build our AudioMemories portfolio. So if you or someone you know would be interested, let me know.
I've posted St. Patrick's Day cards on ebay. It's a 5-day auction to ensure that the cards get to you in time to send out for St. Patty's Day!

I've been down to the studio a few times over the last week and able to work on St. Patrick's Day cards. I'm hoping to get and stay about a month ahead of the holidays this year. A friend of mine said that I should start pricing these. So St. Patty Day cards are $2 each, and 50 cents for shipping up to 2 (more than 2, let me know and I'll figure out the shipping). And, of course, local pick-up is available in the Denver / Boulder area. All of my cards come with envelopes decorated to match. :D

I was able to get to the studio before I went out of town for work, then left on vacation. The inspiration for these was the January "Girlie Girl" swap in ...and our January birthdays: (whose card I haven't scanned yet), my MIL, our neice, and you can never forget Neil Diamond (aka. Ice Cherry by birth). I'm going to call this design Kayla's Flower

We got down to the studio this weekend and I was able to get some cards made. I made a few girly ones using scraps, paper flowers, and a new ribbon. I just LOVE them! The challenge for the community this month was either "Girly Girl" or black & orange. I chose girly girl, of course. For the other girly girl card I picked up some rhinestone martini stickers. I'm excited to get them sent out. Unfortunately, sending them out will have to wait until Friday - since I'm out of town for work this week. Likewise, posting pictures of the new creations will have to wait as well. Besides the girly girl cards, I also attempted something a little more boyish for thank you cards and a birthday card for my brother. I wish I had more time before Valentine's Day to make more of the Girly Girl Flowers. I'll be lucky to finish making cookies before we leave on vacation next Monday. Kyle also started to put together a demo for a project supporting the troops, that we're working to launch. Blue Tower will be offering their services to record deploying members and / or their children reading books. So a soldier that is preparing to deploy can record a book for their child(ren). Or vice versa, the kids can record stories for their deploying parent to take with on a CD. Having deployed myself, I know there are just sometimes when all you want / need is to hear your loved one's voice. And now, as a mommy and a veteran.... ...this project has so much meaning and will be wonderful to work on! Actually, the inspiration kind of came from Kyle's mom. She recorded a CD for Blake, so that he can recognize her voice - since we live so far away. She read a couple books (straight through and then with ad libbing) and recorded herself singing a couple lullabyes. Anyways, this project is still very much so in its infancy. It doesn't even have a name yet.

I FINALLY got all the birth announcements done! I was hoping to get to the studio last night to make new thank you cards (yes, I'm SO far behind), but stayed home since we'll be going home to Minnesota again this weekend. My grandpa's funeral will be Monday. Hence, the reason getting back to the studio has been put off another week. Then I'm hoping to get some holiday (Valentine's Day, Easter, Halloween, Christmas...) and birthday cards done to put together birthday presents for this year. BUT Blake's announcements are done and almost all sent out. (I still have a couple to put ribbons on, but that should get done today if Blake has a good day.) Christmas cards this year were a snapfish.com creation - so easy and pretty cheap! the inside phrase: "God sends his love and joy with each newborn baby's birth."

Blue Tower Studio is expanding its services to include audio memories products such as picture slideshows (with music / personal narration), books on CD, and audio scrapbooks. In order to do this, we are working to expand the studio's (our) portfolio by doing some freebies. Let me know if you would be interested in having a slideshow done, record a book for your favorite child, or create an audio scrapbook. (Of course, any recording has to be done in the Denver metro.) What is an audio scrapbook? Do you love to listen to the stories your grandparents tell you about what it was like when they were growing up? Have you ever asked them about their younger years? Would you like to have those stories recorded? Would you like to tell your story so that your kids can listen to them? Kyle can bring his remote recording system to you and your loved ones to record those cherished stories for a couple hours. They can then be edited into a one-hour CD, with background music of your choice. Kyle did one of these a couple years ago, interviewing his grandparents about Christmas traditions. He gave a copy to all his relatives as a Christmas gift. It turned out awesome!

I finally understand why custom cards can be so darn expensive.... I've already put about 6 hours into Blake's birth announcements. I think to cover the cost of supplies and pay myself under minimum wage, I'd have to charge about $4-5 / card. They're coming along nicely though. I ordered wallet-sized prints to put in them, but when I got them from Snapfish they were printed crooked and chopped off. *sigh* So that's delayed until I get them reprinted. After refilling on a few supplies tomorrow, we plan to be back at the studio tomorrow night. I told Kyle to bring stuff to keep him busy.....or I'll find something to keep him busy. ;)

Blake & I are finally finding a daily routine, which means that I am getting back to life. Since I've moved all my paper crafts down to the studio, it's been harder to work on them because they aren't just "right there". ...not that we really have room for all of it here in the apartment anyways.... *sigh* Oh well, I've been working on my sewing at home. (Almost done with Carter's Thomas the Train quilt for Christmas.) However, I was able to get down to studio Sunday to work on a Christmas card order. My MIL wanted 10 cards based around a packet of stickers and envelopes she had bought. So each one of these are different and I challenged myself to make each one different, using ribbon & ribbits. My next projects are to get Blake's birth announcements made and more baby thank you cards. Investments I need to make: a large paper cutter & a silent setter / hole punch (so I quit scaring the dog - he's a little gun-shy).

I've been busy adjusting to life as a MOMMY!

Blake Alexander was born on
October 13, 2007 at 4:44am.
6 lbs 12.5 oz, 19.25 inches

Last week we had a bout of jaundice and were at the hospital every day, but that's clearing up now. Today is his 10-14 day appointment with his new doctor.

This weekend I'm planning to get down to the studio to make some new cards. I need to make birth announcements for Blake and more baby thank you cards. I'm thinking something with a "window" for Blake's announcements. Maybe a new pop-up design for the thank you cards?

If anyone finds a cutesie dinosaur stamp, let me know. I'm still itching to do a dinosaur stamp design. :D

Kyle and I got down to the studio again last night. :D He worked on putting together the L-desk we got for the front room and I worked on finishing the wedding cards (and putting a few last touches on some thank yous). Of course, that means I found my ribbit / eyelet setting tools. :D Since Kyle was setting up the desk in the front room, I decided to also organize all my stamping stuff on the card table in the storage room. Love Pocket We've had so many weddings this year! I completed 6 of these and will still need to make 2 more to get us through this month. The pocket is attached behind the eyelets with an adhesive Zot and on the bottom with an eyelet through the vellum and card...otherwise the adhesive would have shown through the vellum. I plan to put gift cards in the pockets. This weekend we will be participating in the River North Art District (RiNo) Open House. We'll be there 6-9pm Friday, October 5th and Noon to 4pm Saturday, October 6th Blue Tower Studio 4701 National Western Drive Denver, CO Come out to check out the art or just to say hello. Blue Tower is the only audio studio in the district (that we know of). Also in the Blue Silos Studio building (where we're located) there are painters and sculptures. I highly suggest checking out the glass blowing studios as well - my favorite! Kyle will be playing samples of his work and would be glad to show you how it all works. I will have my cards out and available. :D I promise to bring some homebaked goodies as well - any requests?

I'm getting the itch to scrapbook once again.....and I miss all my stuff! *sigh* Once the apartment is all ready for Baby Nubins, I'll get down to the studio. It's my reward for accomplishing things at home first.

This past weekend we picked up an L-desk for the studio. :D I can't wait to get it set up! Unfortunately, in the transition from here to there I've misplaced my hole punch & ribbit setting tools. Guess I will have to get organized down there before I can continue.

Works in progress: I've got all the pieces cut for the wedding cards, just need to find the ribbit setter. My next project will be to make baby announcements for Baby Nubins. He will be here *hopefully* sometime this month.....though "Grandma Jackie" (my mom) is hoping he waits until after her plane lands in Denver, Nov. 1st.

A pending grandson has my mom starting (and finishing) more and more projects. She's already made me a yo-yo quilt / throw for my rocker and now she's begun crocheting (sp?) a blanket for Nubins to come home from the hospital in. ....and she's dug up a pattern to make him a baptism gown. I figure once the apartment is in order, I can also start working on some of my pending sewing projects (at home)....in addition to going down to the studio to work on my paper crafts. It will be nice to have something to do here and somewhere to get out of the house to. Sewing projects awaiting the scissors & thread: a baby Snoopy book and quilts for Carter, Kayla and Gloria. Then there will also be a baby quilt for Donna's baby, expected sometime this coming spring. (*LOL* Our first children are just shy of 10 years apart, but the next gap will only be about 6 months.)

Kyle and I found time to move all my scrapbooking & cardmaking stuff down to the studio this past weekend! We are working on finding a big desk for the front room, which will double as a front desk AND my workspace. :D I'm definitely looking forward to having time to go down there and be creative. I only have this week left before I go on "maternity leave". So hopefully next week I'll catch up on house work, finish getting Nubins' bedroom all ready for him....and have a chance to go work on some new cards. :D

Very Excited!

I've also been asked to do a photoshoot for my friend, Maggie after the baby's born. She wants some photos since she will be graduating college this winter......and she wants some of Mr. Little Man - Winston, her Jack Russell Terrier.

My next challenge: I need to make wedding cards for all the weddings we've missed this summer...and all the weddings coming up this fall. This is truly the year of weddings. We had 3 in June, 1 this month, and 3 more next month!

A baby trend is definitely starting too. One friend's wife will be induced (with twins) tomorrow, Nubins will probably be born in about a month now, my cousin is due in December, a friend of mine is due in February, and another friend is due in April....and we have another friend that's starting the adoption process. :D

I finally got around to finishing up the first round of shower thank you cards.... As well as scanning the shower invites & thank yous. Desert Dinosaurs Note: There are actually 5 different dinosaurs, here is just a sample of 2 of them. On the inside I printed up (and attached) white inserts ready for Kendra to fill out. Jesse Baby Feet - Blue These are the ones I designed for Michelle's baby shower. I liked them so much that I made a bunch for myself to use as thank you cards. This afternoon I was able to mail out all the thank yous from my first baby shower (the Minnesota shower). So I am all caught up with baby cards. Next I need to work on wedding cards....for all those weddings we missed this summer and have coming up this fall. I also need to design a birthday card for my very special godson, Tony. Hmmm....how do I do transformers? What do 10 year old boys even like nowadays?

I'm working on cards tonight for another co-worker's baby shower. She is naming her baby boy Jesse James....... Nursery theme is Superman (and other random superheros that have collected over her pregnancy). However, it's hard to find Superman papercraft stuff that I like. I did a Superman page for my godson, Tony's birthday one year and ended up drawing a web all over the page and matting the pictures with blue & red.

So instead of doing Superman cards - as I had originally planned - I picked out a super light blue for the card part. I plan to put a white square (decorated trim?) with pastel blue baby feet stamps. Around the top I plan to wrap around & tie a ribbon that's attached through the back of the card. I think this design will be easily done in pink as well.

I'm also making these for my baby shower thank you cards, with the only difference being that I plan to find little "thank you" charms to attach on the ribbon. Michelle's cards will be left blank, with an offer to stamp whatever she wants on the inside.

Promise to scan the Desert Dinosaurs and Jesse Baby Feet this weekend! We can finally get into the second bedroom and to the desk. The crib and changing table are put together (and "dressed"). This weekend I plan to bring my crafting supplies down to the studio and get a work space set up there! That way I can have crafting time when Kyle is recording. Our little Nubins will pretty much grow up in the studio, with Mommy crafting and Daddy making record albums. :D

Back to not working....coloring in the little hearts of the "handmade with love!" stamp on the back of cards - at my desk.

I went to post these this morning, but weblogimages.com was acting up. Pink & Blue Baby Feet Thank You When Kyle & I found out we were expecting an addition to our household, some of our family and friends sent cards and gift of congratulations. Everyone's generosity and good wishes was much appreciated (and a wonderful surprise). I made these as thank you notes with pink & blue baby feet, since we didn't know what we were having yet. Pink & Green Baby Feet Thank You A variation of the Baby Feet Thank You was requested with pink and green for a customer who wanted shower thank yous. Pink Teddy Bear Gingham More baby stuff & trying out some more ribbon. Blue Teddy Bear Gingham Everyone's having baby boys lately! We are currently in the process of putting our apartment back together after all of the floors were replaced. Once I can get to the scanner there will be more designs scanned. ....and once I can get to my crafts, there will be new designs on the way. It's my plan to at least have my shower thank yous designed and made by the end of next weekend.

A few girly / multi-use designs. I was asked to come up with some girl designs and at the same time my mom wanted some everyday cards. The green didn't scan quite right on this one....it's supposed to be more of a soft, sage green. The daisies are actually appliques (sp?). This pastel yellow is adorned with a pearlescent lime green. At the flower ends there is glitter and rhinestones in the middle of the scrolls. This design was inspired by an Easter card we got from Kyle's cousin's wife, Alicia. (Got that relation? Would that be a cousin in-law, in-law?) The middle butterfly pops out a little further than the other two. All the butterflies are adorned with glitter and a few glittery stickers. I've also done some of these in purple & yellow! With this one I was wanting to do something a little bit different and the 4th of July was coming up. I wanted to do something with the music staff I had bought in honor of Kyle. *LOL* Here's an interesting tidbit: It's storming outside (windy, lighting, thunder, sprinks, overcast even) and the ice cream truck is making its way around the neighborhood. I can hear it's little joyful song outside.

I'm finally getting around to creating a blog for my card designs. I was going to wait and just create a website, but figure I already love to use LJ..... So instead of saturating my personal LJ (
astridlynn
) with these, I may as well create a blog for my cards (and eventually scrapbook pages).

I sell most of these cards for $1 per card (with the exception of some cards using extra special stickers & embellishments). All cards also come with matching envelopes. Occassionally I will post sets on ebay, so watch for discounted sets there too. The insides on most of my cards are left blank, or can be customized for whatever you want. (For example, I printed up insides for the shower invites I recently made.)

The newest design I have scanned is Emily Frogs. A co-worker of mine just had a little baby girl, Emily Olivia. I made these as a gift for her baby shower, since she decorated the nursery with frogs. She decided to use them as baby announcements.



Most recently, I've made shower invitations for my Colorado baby shower....to include cloth cartoon dinosaurs. (Will upload this weekend. My next project is to make new thank you cards for the shower Mom R & Nicki hosted for me in Minnesota.
